title: How to Make Savoury Olive Oil Biscuits
category_hierarchy: Crackers and Savory Cookies and Biscuits

steps.headline: Set your oven to 475ºF.
steps.description: Spray the cookie sheet with non-stick cooking spray. Alternatively, line it with parchment paper.

steps.headline: In a mixing bowl, tip in the flour, baking powder and salt.
Melt the butter in a microwave or saucepan.
steps.description: Add the melted butter to the batter. Mix well.

steps.headline: Put a handful of flour onto a cutting board and rolling pin.
steps.description: Place the biscuit dough onto the cutting board. Roll over the dough to flatten it just a little.

steps.headline: Make a ball out of the biscuit dough.
steps.description: Flatten the ball with a rolling pin. It should be about as thick as your palm.

steps.headline: Use a biscuit cutter to make separate biscuits.
steps.description: A round shape is ideal. You can use a glass end if you don't have a biscuit cutter.

steps.headline: Place the biscuits on cookie sheet.
steps.description: Repeat cutting and adding biscuits until there is no more biscuit dough left.

steps.headline: Put cookie sheet in the oven.
steps.description: Set a timer for 11 to 15 minutes. The biscuits are ready when they just start to turn golden brown.

steps.headline: Take the biscuits out when baked.
steps.description: Let cool for 2-3 minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer to wire cooling rack to finish cooling.

steps.headline: Serve or store.
steps.description: If storing, keep in an airtight container.

text: Set your oven to 475ºF. Spray the cookie sheet with non-stick cooking spray. Alternatively, line it with parchment paper. In a mixing bowl, tip in the flour, baking powder and salt.  Add the milk. Mix. Add 1/3 cup of olive oil. Mix in the olive oil. Melt the butter in a microwave or saucepan. Add the melted butter to the batter. Mix well. Put a handful of flour onto a cutting board and rolling pin. Place the biscuit dough onto the cutting board. Roll over the dough to flatten it just a little. Make a ball out of the biscuit dough. Flatten the ball with a rolling pin. It should be about as thick as your palm. Use a biscuit cutter to make separate biscuits. A round shape is ideal. You can use a glass end if you don't have a biscuit cutter. Place the biscuits on cookie sheet. Repeat cutting and adding biscuits until there is no more biscuit dough left. Put cookie sheet in the oven. Set a timer for 11 to 15 minutes. The biscuits are ready when they just start to turn golden brown. Take the biscuits out when baked. Let cool for 2-3 minutes on the baking sheet, then transfer to wire cooling rack to finish cooling. Serve or store. If storing, keep in an airtight container.
